title: Parliament Winter Session 2024 Day 17 LIVE updates: ‘Ambedkar opposed Art 370’, claims Hardeep Puri in Rajya Sabha - The Hindu
Why NSA Ajit Doval’s China Visit Is Key: Exclusive On December 18 Talks - News18
summary:
NSA Ajit Doval’s Upcoming China Visit: Key Talks on December 18

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

National Security Advisor Ajit Doval is set to visit China for Special Representative (SR) talks on December 18, focusing on LAC disengagement amidst hope for meaningful dialogue to prevent incidents similar to Galwan.

  • The visit is part of ongoing negotiations following the eastern Ladakh military standoff that began in May 2020.
  • Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi will represent China during the talks.
  • The discussions aim to clarify the Line of Actual Control (LAC) and resolve operational issues to prevent further confrontations.
  • Expectations are hopeful for achieving significant progress and defining timelines for future meetings.
“We are hopeful to have meaningful dialogue with China for further engagement and to avoid a Galwan-like incident,” said government sources.

This visit could be crucial for stabilizing relations and defining clear operational boundaries in the ongoing India-China dialogue.
newTitle: NSA Ajit Doval’s Upcoming China Visit: Key Talks on December 18

title: ‘If you don’t know how to fight polls…': BJP to Rahul Gandhi after Omar Abdullah's jibe at INDIA ally Cong - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP Criticizes Rahul Gandhi Over Election Strategy After Omar Abdullah's Comments

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has urged Rahul Gandhi to stop blaming electronic voting machines for the Congress party's electoral failures, emphasizing the need for a solid election strategy instead.

  • The BJP states that leadership qualities cannot be imposed and must be earned.
  • BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra termed the opposition INDIA bloc as a "scam'' due to its divided leadership.
  • Omar Abdullah emphasized that Congress needs to justify its leading role in the alliance.
  • Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee spoke on the credibility of EVMs and challenged opposition members to prove their allegations.
  • Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis suggested Congress introspect instead of blaming EVMs for election losses.
“Leadership is not earned and not demanded. You have to have the qualities of a leader. You cannot impose yourself.” - Sambit Patra

The BJP's response highlights the ongoing tensions within the opposition alliance and calls into question the unity and effectiveness of its electoral strategies.
newTitle: BJP Criticizes Rahul Gandhi Over Election Strategy After Omar Abdullah's Comments

title: Parliament Winter Session Live: Cong MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra demands restoration of '71 war photo - Hindustan Times
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi Demands Restoration of 1971 War Photo in Parliament

Published on: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

During the Winter Session of Parliament, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra called for the restoration of a photo depicting the surrender of the Pakistani army during the 1971 war.

  • The final week of the Winter Session began with discussions on various important topics.
  • Priyanka Gandhi highlighted the bravery of soldiers in the 1971 war.
  • Government's decision on introducing bills for simultaneous elections has been deferred.
  • The session also involved debates on other political issues, including farmers' protests and minority rights.
“I want to salute the brave soldiers who fought for us in the war of 1971.” - Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

Gandhi's comments stirred significant debate, emphasizing the importance of remembering historical events and acknowledging past sacrifices.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Demands Restoration of 1971 War Photo in Parliament

RAU Compounder & Nurse Online Form 2024 - SarkariExam.com
summary:
RAU Compounder & Nurse Online Form 2024

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Rajasthan Agricultural University (RAU)

Rajasthan Agricultural University (RAU) has issued a notification for the recruitment of Compounder and Nurse for a total of 740 positions. The online application process commenced on December 16, 2024, and will remain open until January 15, 2025.

Key Details:

  • Notification Date: 12 December 2024
  • Application Start Date: 16 December 2024
  • Last Date for Application: 15 January 2025
  • Application Fee: Rs. 600/- for General, OBC, EBC; Rs. 400/- for SC, ST, PH
  • Total Vacancies: 740 (650 Non-TSP, 90 TSP)
  • Age Limit: 18 to 40 years

Application Process:

Candidates can apply online through the official RAU website. Further details can be found on RAU's official site.

Educational Qualification:

Candidates should possess a Degree/Diploma in Ayurveda Nursing from a recognized university.
newTitle: RAU Compounder & Nurse Online Form 2024 Announcement

title: Supreme Court Weekly Round-up: December 9, 2024 To December 15, 2024 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Weekly Round-up: December 9, 2024 To December 15, 2024

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 Source: LiveLaw

This week, the Supreme Court delivered several important judgments across a range of legal issues, including interpretations of the Indian Penal Code, property rights under Hindu law, and the responsibilities under various legal provisions.

  • Kunhimuhammed v. State of Kerala: Conviction for murder upheld, emphasizing intention irrelevant if serious injury is inflicted.
  • NHAI v. G Athipathi: Rejection of promotion claim based on deputation; continuity of service questioned.
  • Tej Bhan v. Ram Kishan: Referring conflicting opinions on rights of female Hindus under Hindu Succession Act.
  • Leela Agrawal v. Sarkar: Clarification on mortgage transactions and possession rights.
  • Dara Lakshmi Narayana v. State of Telangana: Warning against misuse of IPC Section 498A in domestic disputes.
  • Parvin Kumar Jain v. Anju Jain: Permanent alimony set at Rs. 5 Crores; emphasis on the obligation to provide for children.
“The right to maintenance is commensurate to the right to sustenance...” - Supreme Court

As these cases reflect significant judicial interpretations, they have far-reaching implications for legal standards and societal norms in India.
newTitle: Supreme Court Weekly Round-up: December 9-15, 2024

Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: ‘TMC chief opposed caste census’, accuses JDU MP; Congress rakes RSS in Rajya Sabha

title: "Stupid Things": BJP vs Congress Over Priyanka Gandhi's 'Palestine' Bag - NDTV
Those Who Give Money To Beggars Will Now Face Police Case In This City - NDTV
summary:
Those Who Give Money To Beggars Will Face Police Case In This City

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Indore, known as India's cleanest city, is launching a new initiative to eliminate begging by threatening legal action against those who give money to beggars. Starting January 1, FIRs will be filed against anyone caught giving alms.

  • The district administration aims to register FIRs against anyone giving money to beggars.
  • A ban on begging has already been issued in Indore.
  • The initiative is part of a central government pilot project involving ten cities.
  • Revelations during the campaign uncovered that some beggars have significant assets.
  • An Indore-based organization will support rehabilitation efforts, providing shelter and job assistance.
“I appeal to all residents of Indore not to become partners in the sin by giving alms to people.” - Ashish Singh, District Collector

This initiative highlights the city's commitment to addressing the issue of begging through strict enforcement and rehabilitation measures.
newTitle: Indore's New Initiative to Combat Begging: FIRs for Donors

title: How Supreme Court's Judgment In Nestle Case Is Linked To Switzerland Revoking India's MFN Status - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
How Supreme Court's Judgment In Nestle Case Is Linked To Switzerland Revoking India's MFN Status

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

Last week, Switzerland decided to revoke the Most Favoured Nation (MFN) treatment for India starting January 1, 2025, based on a Supreme Court ruling related to a tax dispute involving Nestle.

  • Switzerland claims its decision follows a 2023 Supreme Court judgment regarding Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement.
  • The ruling states that DTAA cannot be enforced unless notified by India's Central Government under Section 90 of the Income Tax Act.
  • The court emphasizes that a treaty with a third country benefiting from OECD membership requires explicit notification to amend tax benefits.
  • Companies like Nestle, Steria India, and others challenged this in hopes of gaining FMN rights based on their existing DTAAs.
“Absent this step, treaties and protocols are per se unenforceable,” the Supreme Court concluded.

This ruling has significant implications for India's international tax agreements and could affect foreign businesses operating in India.
newTitle: Supreme Court's Ruling Affects India's MFN Status with Switzerland

title: Wrong Practice Of Converting Civil Disputes Into Criminal Cases Rampant In Many States : Supreme Court - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Wrong Practice Of Converting Civil Disputes Into Criminal Cases Rampant In Many States : Supreme Court

Date: December 16 | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court expressed concerns over the growing trend of converting civil disputes into criminal cases, emphasizing that such practices need to be strongly checked.

  • The Supreme Court bench included CJI Sanjiv Khanna and Justice Sanjay Kumar.
  • A plea was being heard regarding the quashing of criminal charges related to a property sale dispute.
  • The court noted that the complainant only filed a criminal case despite the nature of the issue being predominantly civil.
  • CJI Khanna highlighted that this practice is rampant in several states and needs to be curtailed.
  • The case will be reviewed again in March 2025.
“This is again one of those cases where a civil default/ civil case is converted into a criminal one and this has to be checked very strongly.”
newTitle: Supreme Court Warns Against Converting Civil Disputes into Criminal Cases

title: ‘Helped us immensely’: Sri Lankan President Dissanayake thanks India for $5 billion economic support - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sri Lankan President Dissanayake Thanks India for $5 Billion Economic Support

Date: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake expressed gratitude to India for its significant economic support during Sri Lanka's financial crisis, particularly emphasizing the crucial assistance in debt restructuring.

  • Dissanayake is on his first bilateral visit to New Delhi after winning elections.
  • India has provided $5 billion in aid through credits and grants.
  • New projects announced include railway system rehabilitation and educational scholarships.
  • Dissanayake assured that Sri Lanka's territory will not be used against India's interests.
  • India plans to finalize a defense cooperation agreement with Sri Lanka soon.
“We faced an unprecedented economic crisis some 2 years ago and India supported us immensely to come out of that quagmire.” - Anura Kumara Dissanayake

This collaboration is poised to flourish, focusing on regional security, infrastructure, and various developmental projects in Sri Lanka.
newTitle: Sri Lankan President Dissanayake Thanks India for $5 Billion Economic Support

title: IMD Hyderabad issues first cold wave warning this winter as temperatures dip - The Siasat Daily
summary:
IMD Hyderabad Issues First Cold Wave Warning This Winter

Date: December 2023 - Source: Siasat Daily

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) Hyderabad has issued its first cold wave warning of the current winter season, indicating a significant drop in temperatures across Telangana.

  • Minimum temperatures are expected to drop to as low as 5 degrees Celsius in certain districts.
  • Most impacted districts include Adilabad, Kamareddy, and Nirmal, with the lowest temperature recorded at 6.3 degrees Celsius.
  • Other districts report temperatures below 10 degrees Celsius, highlighting the cold wave's intensity.
  • Hyderabad also issued a yellow alert for winter conditions.
  • Maredpally recorded the lowest minimum temperature in Hyderabad at 9.7 degrees Celsius.
"The cold wave is set to affect multiple districts in the state." - IMD Hyderabad

The cold wave is likely to persist, impacting daily activities and weather patterns across the region.
newTitle: IMD Hyderabad Issues First Cold Wave Warning This Winter

title: 'Random statements': TMC's Abhishek Banerjee dismisses Congress's EVM tampering claim - The Times of India
Parliament Winter Session 2024 Day 17 LIVE updates: BJP against Caste Census, giving ‘jumlas’ to befool everyone and then blame us: Kharge in RS - The Hindu
summary:
Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: ‘Ambedkar opposed Art 370’, claims Hardeep Puri in Rajya Sabha

Date & Source: December 16, 2024 - The Hindu

The Parliament is currently in its winter session, with significant discussions on constitutional matters taking place. Key highlights from the session include statements from Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman criticizing the Congress party and remarks from Hardeep Puri on Article 370.

  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman denounces the Congress party as 'anti-women' for their stance on the Women’s Reservation Bill.
  • Hardeep Puri asserts that Dr. B.R. Ambedkar opposed Article 370, citing historical context and urging that the Congress party failed to act appropriately.
  • Debates are ongoing about inflation, economic policies, and women's rights in the context of India's parliamentary system.
“What should have been a temporary arrangement gained a permanent nature because the Congress did not have the courage to Act,” said Hardeep Puri.

This session has revealed deep political divides and ongoing controversies regarding the legacy and future of the Indian Constitution.
newTitle: Parliament Winter Session Day 17: Hardeep Puri Claims Ambedkar Opposed Article 370

title: Stricter anti-pollution measures reinforced in Delhi as AQI drops amid cold wave - Hindustan Times
summary:
Stricter Anti-Pollution Measures Reinforced in Delhi as AQI Drops Amid Cold Wave

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre's air quality panel has invoked the third phase of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP-3) in Delhi-NCR due to poor air quality and a cold wave affecting the region.

  • GRAP-3 imposes a ban on non-essential construction and strict vehicle regulations in response to rising pollution.
  • The AQI surged into the 'very poor' category, prompting governmental action.
  • Current temperatures have dropped significantly, exacerbating pollution levels.
  • Restrictions include prohibiting petrol vehicles not meeting BS-III norms and diesel vehicles failing to comply with BS-IV standards.
  • Dust suppression methods have been enhanced, including mechanized road-sweeping and water-sprinkling.
  • Diesel generators are limited to emergency use only due to their contribution to pollution.
The Air Quality Index (AQI) reached 351, indicating 'very poor' air quality.

This decision highlights the urgent actions being taken to combat pollution in Delhi while contending with harsh weather conditions that complicate air quality management.
newTitle: Stricter Anti-Pollution Measures Reinforced in Delhi Amid Cold Wave

title: "Chemical Castration Harsh But...": Supreme Court On Women's Safety Plea - NDTV
GRAP-3 Restrictions Back In Delhi-NCR, Hybrid Mode Up To Class 5 - NDTV
summary:
GRAP-3 Restrictions Back In Delhi-NCR, Hybrid Mode Up To Class 5

Publication Date: November 18, 2024

Source: NDTV

The GRAP-III restrictions have been reimposed across Delhi-NCR due to severe air pollution, affecting schools and vehicle regulations.

  • All schools in Delhi-NCR must switch to a hybrid mode for students up to Class V.
  • Restrictions on diesel-powered commercial vehicles are enforced.
  • Goods vehicles not meeting the BS-IV emission standard are banned from entering the city.
  • Government offices will stagger working hours to mitigate pollution impact.
  • Delhi's Air Quality Index (AQI) reached 366, entering the 'very poor' category.
The Supreme Court criticized the authorities for not strictly enforcing pollution measures when AQI crossed the 300-mark.

The reimplementation of GRAP-III signifies a critical response to ongoing air quality crises in Delhi, reflecting the urgent need for effective pollution control measures.
newTitle: GRAP-3 Restrictions Back In Delhi-NCR, Hybrid Mode Up To Class 5

title: Sri Lankan president Dissanayake meets PM Modi in Delhi, vows not to use country’s territory for anti-India activities - The Indian Express
summary:
Sri Lankan president Dissanayake meets PM Modi, vows not to let the country’s territory be used for anti-India activities

Publication Date: Not specifiedSource: Indian Express

Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that his country will not allow its territory to be used for activities that harm India while meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi. He expressed gratitude for India's support during Sri Lanka's economic crisis.

  • The two leaders discussed strengthening bilateral ties and cooperation.
  • They signed agreements on avoiding double taxation and capacity building.
  • Topics included maritime security, cyber security, and infrastructure projects like the Sampur solar power project.
  • Dissanayake's visit marks his first overseas trip since taking office.
“The visit of President Dissanayake to India shall further strengthen the multifaceted and mutually beneficial cooperation between the two countries,” stated the MEA spokesperson.

President Dissanayake's commitment to India's security concerns illustrates a strategic approach to maintain solid diplomatic relations.
newTitle: Sri Lankan President Dissanayake Reaffirms Commitment to Indo-Sri Lanka Relations

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Priyanka Gandhi has made headlines for her bold stance regarding a Palestinian flag bag she wore, stating that she will wear whatever she wants, challenging societal norms and expectations.

  • Priyanka Gandhi addressed criticism over wearing a bag with a Palestinian flag.

"I will wear what I want, and this is a matter of personal choice that cannot be dictated by others."

title: 'Ban Free Online Pornography, Castrate Rapists' : PIL Seeks Measures For Women Safety; Supreme Court... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Examines PIL for Women's Safety and Regulation of Online Pornography

Publication Date: Today | Source: News Agency

The Supreme Court has taken notice of a public interest litigation (PIL) requesting national guidelines to enhance the safety of women in India, including a ban on free online pornography and castration of convicted sex offenders.

  • The PIL aims to implement pan-India safety guidelines and address the vulnerabilities of women, particularly in public transport.
  • A significant part of the plea is to evaluate the effectiveness of existing laws concerning violence against women and children.
  • The court recognized some proposals as innovative while expressing concern over others being potentially barbaric.
  • Senior Advocate Mahalakshmi Pavani represented the PIL, highlighting ongoing incidents of violence against women and the media's role in underreporting such cases.
  • Calls for CCTV installation in workplaces and fast-tracking trials for sexual offenses are included, alongside preventing accused politicians from contesting elections.
“The easy access to pornographic material has a direct link with the spurt in sexual offenses across the country.”

This hearing coincides with the anniversary of the Nirbhaya gangrape incident, emphasizing the ongoing need for systemic changes regarding women's safety in India.
newTitle: Supreme Court Examines PIL for Women's Safety and Regulation of Online Pornography

title: 'If Muslim processions can ...': Yogi Adityanath speaks in UP Assembly on communal violence - Moneycontrol
Priyanka Gandhi carries ‘Palestine’ bag to Parliament, BJP says ‘appeasement’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi Carries 'Palestine' Bag to Parliament, BJP Criticizes 'Appeasement'

Date: Dec 16, 2024, Source: Hindustan Times

Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has made headlines by carrying a bag adorned with 'Palestine' to Parliament, expressing her support for the Palestinian cause. This act has sparked a backlash from BJP leaders who accuse her of political appeasement.

  • Priyanka Gandhi carried a bag with 'Palestine' and emblems symbolizing solidarity during the Winter Session of Parliament.
  • Congress spokesperson Dr. Shama Mohammed emphasized this as a gesture of compassion and a commitment to justice.
  • Vadra has actively condemned Israeli actions in Gaza, referring to them as genocidal.
  • BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra criticized the gesture, linking it to historical political failures of the Gandhi family.
“It is the moral responsibility of every right-thinking individual… to condemn the Israeli government's genocidal actions and force them to stop,” Priyanka Gandhi Vadra stated.

This incident highlights the ongoing political divide regarding international issues and the role of public figures in expressing solidarity with global causes.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Carries 'Palestine' Bag to Parliament, BJP Criticizes 'Appeasement'

The 17th day of the Winter session of Parliament included significant discussions regarding atrocities faced by Hindus in Bangladesh, with Priyanka Gandhi urging action from the government. Mallikarjun Kharge’s BIG Retort to PM Modi Over Constitution Debate

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge emphasized the importance of adhering to the Constitution and criticized those who previously opposed it.

  • Kharge stated that merely blaming each other is unproductive.

title: ACS Shaleen Kabra to head Committee over Promotion avenues of JKAS Officers - Cross Town News
Sambhal: Broken idols of Hindu deities found near newly uncovered temple, say cops - Hindustan Times
summary:
Broken Idols Discovered Near Ancient Temple in Sambhal

Date: Dec 16, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Authorities in Sambhal have recovered three broken idols during excavation work near a newly uncovered Hindu temple, which had been closed since 1978.

  • The Shiv-Hanuman Temple was reopened on December 14, 2024.
  • The idols are believed to belong to Lord Ganesh and Lord Kartikeya.
  • The discovery was made during digging for a well.
  • Devotees painted religious slogans on the temple walls.
  • Security measures have been enhanced at the temple.
“The area has been secured so that excavation can be done smoothly,” said Sambhal ASP Shrish Chandra.

This discovery is significant as it coincides with the reopening of the ancient temple, highlighting a revitalization of religious practices in the region amidst recent tensions.
newTitle: Broken Idols Discovered Near Ancient Temple in Sambhal
